text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that in the US, *only* the warped, mocking version of the character may be protected. The candidate answer discusses all three infringing shirts (crazy sunglasses, worker's rights advocate, warped mockery) under US law, noting that all modified versions are derivative works and that the primary defense would be Fair Use, which is unlikely to succeed for any of them.
